title: How to Shoot for Depth of Field

steps.headline: Make it work for you.
steps.description: You will always have some type of DOF in your shots so make it work for you, not against you.

steps.headline: Use the modes that your camera came with.
steps.description: That is the quickest and easiest way to get the right depth of field.

steps.headline: Learn what controls your depth of field and how.
Use your DOF scale.
steps.description: Set the focusing ring’s infinity mark (sideways 8) opposite of the selected aperture mark on the depth-of-field scale. The depth of field will then run from half the focused distance to infinity.

steps.headline: If you have it, use your DOF preview.
steps.description: Some cameras come with the ability to preview your image and showing your DOF. Take advantage of it, if you have it.

steps.headline: Learn to use your DOF creatively.
